page.title: 11THE FARMING YEAR
page.content: At the beginning of the year there is often bad weather with snow causing problems with lambing.Lambs can be born backwards,the mothers leave them,steal them or have a prolapse. Calving follows with similar difficulties,often in the middle of the night. The year contines with silage being made in May. Sheep need treatment as summer comes so they are clipped and dipped for protection from insects. Farmers hope to begin cropping hay in July but bad weather can stop them. Then they have to hire contracters to do the work with round balers. In September lamb sales begin.There are marts in Bellingham,Hexham and further away. These go on through the autumn and farmers buy in winter feed. Sheep and cattle are brought in to sheds as the winter begins again.
